Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with band of single dots in added white; below, white and added red lines; exterior: possible lotus flower and lotus bud chain with traces of white and red blobs.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1167) (phase 2)
